translation.en: EMERSON: It's life or death now, James.
By that, I mean you're doing one or the other
translation.ko: 둘 중 하나, 넌 끝난다는 뜻이지

translation.en: up in Rockview.
This here is District Attorney Rodin.
Want to know what he's wondering?
Whether you're gonna walk like a man or cry like a pussy on your way to the death house.
translation.ko: 네놈이 사형장에 꼿꼿하게 걸어갈지, 울며불며 끌려갈지

translation.en: See, the D.A. likes the needle,
whereas me, I like to see a man like you live a long life
with all your teeth knocked out.
translation.ko: 당하길 원하지 거기가 헐어 방귀도 못 뀔 만큼!

translation.en: Passed around till a brother can't tell your fart from a yawn.
translation.ko: 거기가 헐어 방귀도 못 뀔 만큼!

translation.en: Now, I don't know what kind of man you are, which of these two fates you prefer,
but Rodin here is a generous fellow.
He's willing to let you take your pick.
translation.ko: 검사님이 선택하게 해준다는 군 대신 길고 비싼 재판을 안 하도록

translation.en: If you save us and this city a long and costly trial,
translation.ko: 대신 길고 비싼 재판을 안 하도록 변호인 선임 권리를 포기한다고 써

translation.en: waive your right to counsel and confess, right now.
Sixteen hours. Has to be some kind of record, Detective.
What the hell is this?
Who the hell is Jack Reacher?
Jack Reacher,
born Jack, not John, no middle name,
is a ghost.
translation.ko: 존재하지 않아요, 유령처럼! 운전면허도, 거주지 기록도 없어요

translation.en: No driver's license, current or expired. No residence, current or former.
No credit cards, no credit history. No P.O. box, cell phone, e-mail.
Nothing.
Can you at least tell me who he is?
translation.ko: 그럼 대체 누구요? 가문이 뼛속까지 군인이란 기록은 있어요

translation.en: Well, I can tell you who he was. Blood military.
Born and raised on bases abroad.
translation.ko: 해외 주둔지에서 출생, 성장했고 어머닌 프랑스 혈통 아버진 해병대 출신

translation.en: Mother was a French national, father in the Corps.
translation.ko: 어머닌 프랑스 혈통 아버진 해병대 출신 육사에 입학하면서 미국에 들어왔어요

translation.en: His first trip to the United States
was to attend West Point.
Four years later, he ships out for good.
Iraq. Afghanistan. The Balkans. You name it.
Served with distinction.
translation.ko: 혁혁한 공도 세웠어요 은성 훈장, 청동 성장 유공 훈장

translation.en: Silver Star, Bronze Star, Legion of Merit.
translation.ko: 은성 훈장, 청동 성장 유공 훈장

translation.en: Defense Superior Service Medal? Had to look that one up.
translation.ko: 우수 근무 훈장? 이런 훈장 처음 들어요

translation.en: And a Purple Heart. He spent the bulk of his service
in the Military Police.
By all accounts, a brilliant investigator.
translation.ko: 주로 헌병대, 탁월한 수사관이었어요 문제를 일으켜

translation.en: Apparently, a troublemaker, too.
Demoted to Captain.
Worked his way back to Major.
Then two years ago, he musters out.
translation.ko: 2년 전 군복 벗었어요 군대에서 뼈를 묻을 것 같더니

translation.en: After a literal lifetime in the military,
he just up and quits. And then,
translation.ko: 군대에서 뼈를 묻을 것 같더니 두 번째 미국에 들어와 증발했어요

translation.en: for only the second time in his life, he enters the United States and simply disappears.
RODIN: Dead, maybe?
translation.ko: 사망한 거요? 버지니아 주 은행 정보엔 생존자입니다

translation.en: EMERSON: Not according to Social Security
and a bank account in Virginia.
translation.ko: 버지니아 주 은행 정보엔 생존자입니다 누군가가 연금을 대신 받아 보내줘요

translation.en: His pension is deposited monthly and someone is making the occasional withdrawal. All wire transfers.
I can't find out where without a federal warrant.
RODIN: Well, he can't drive or fly.
At least not under his real name.
Any warrants? EMERSON: Record's clean.
Oh, come on! A guy this hard to find?
Gotta be wanted for something.
His record is clean.
So,
how do we find this Reacher?
translation.ko: 어떻게 찾소? 제 발로 오기 전엔 꿈 깨십쇼

translation.en: Obviously, you don't find this guy unless he wants to be found.
translation.ko: 제 발로 오기 전엔 꿈 깨십쇼

translation.en: Excuse me, sir. There's a Jack Reacher here to see you.
Can I help you?
James Barr.
So, now you've seen him. How do you know him?
Why wasn't he in protective custody?
That was an oversight.
translation.ko: 우리가 방심했소 무방비 미결수를 늑대 소굴에 처넣다니!

translation.en: More like some Corrections flunky threw him to the wolves.
EMERSON: Just as likely.
But it's done and we can't undo it.
So what happens now?
translation.ko: 어떻게 되는 거요? 지금은 혼수 상태고...

translation.en: Well, now he's in a coma.
We'll try him when he wakes up. If he wakes up.
translation.ko: 의식이 돌아오면 법정에 세울 거요 이제 우리가 묻죠

translation.en: Okay? Now it's your turn, Reacher.
translation.ko: 이제 우리가 묻죠 왜 그가 댁을 증인으로 내세웠죠?

translation.en: Why did he call you as a witness?
translation.ko: 왜 그가 댁을 증인으로 내세웠죠? 그랬을 리 없소

translation.en: I don't believe he did.
translation.ko: 그랬을 리 없소 그쪽 이름을 댔소

translation.en: Well, I believe he asked for you by name.
Any chance I could look at the evidence?
translation.ko: 증거물 볼 수 있소? 추가 질문에 대답...

translation.en: No way. Not till you answer some questions.
Nice meeting you.
Hey. Hey. Hey! Mr. Reacher.
translation.ko: 리처 씨 잠깐만, 면회 하게 해줬잖소 아는 걸 불어요

translation.en: Mr. Reacher! Hey, stop! Stop right there! We had a deal.
translation.ko: 잠깐만, 면회 하게 해줬잖소 아는 걸 불어요

translation.en: I take you to Barr, you tell me what you know.
translation.ko: 잠깐만, 면회 하게 해줬잖소 아는 걸 불어요 다섯 명 쐈고, 혼수 상태며 버스 정류장은

translation.en: I know you say he shot five people, I know he's in a coma.
translation.ko: 다섯 명 쐈고, 혼수 상태며 버스 정류장은

translation.en: I know there's a bus station three miles away
and I can walk there in 24 minutes.
So you're just going to walk out on your friend?
He's not my friend.
translation.ko: -친구 아니오 -그럼 그가 왜 댁에게 그런 걸 요청하오?

translation.en: RODIN: Why'd he ask for you, then? Well, same reason he shot five people, he's crazy.
translation.ko: 다섯을 죽인 이유와 같소 미친 놈이죠

translation.en: Hey. Hold on.
Don't do that.
translation.ko: 건들지 마시오 두 분 또 야비한 수법인가요?

translation.en: HELEN: Well, this is a new low, even for both of you.
Uh-oh.
translation.ko: 두 분 또 야비한 수법인가요? 저 없을 땐 바에게 말 걸지 마요

translation.en: You do not talk to my client without me present.
translation.ko: 저 없을 땐 바에게 말 걸지 마요

translation.en: You know that. RODIN: We weren't talking to your client.
He's in a coma, for Christ's sakes.
translation.ko: 혼수 상태인데 어떻게 말을 걸겠나? -바의 변호인? -헬렌 로딘, 잭 리처

translation.en: You're Barr's attorney? Helen Rodin, Jack Reacher.
translation.ko: -바의 변호인? -헬렌 로딘, 잭 리처 -잭 리처? -헬렌 로딘이면?

translation.en: Jack Reacher? Helen Rodin.
translation.ko: -잭 리처? -헬렌 로딘이면? 맞소, 지검장님 딸! 흥미롭게 됐죠

translation.en: Yeah, she's the District Attorney's daughter.
I'd like to hear it.
translation.ko: 듣고 싶군요 어떻게 찾았죠? 왜 검찰이 이 분을 만나죠?

translation.en: How'd you find him? How'd they find you? You can't be talking to this man.
translation.ko: 어떻게 찾았죠? 왜 검찰이 이 분을 만나죠?

translation.en: Two strikes in one day.
It's not what it looks like. He came to us.
You went to the D.A.? Is there a law against that?
None you're currently breaking.
translation.ko: 아직은... "법정에서 봅시다" 하세요, 판 깨지 말고!

translation.en: Come on, before this gets awkward. Now, hey.
Say, "See you in court." For me.
translation.ko: "법정에서 봅시다" 하세요, 판 깨지 말고! 잘 가요, 형사님!

translation.en: Goodbye, Detective.
Weird meeting you. Likewise.
Let's go.
So...
So, you're Jack Reacher.
So you're the D.A.'s daughter.
Oh, Jesus. Please.
Is that even legal? Fortunately.
translation.ko: -그거 합법이오? -운 좋게도! -그게 어떻게? -증인 선서 하면 말해주죠

translation.en: How does that happen?
I'll tell you after deposition. You don't want to depose me.
Oh, well, you're my only defense witness. I'm not a defense witness.
Your friend James thinks you are.
translation.ko: -증인 아뇨 -친구 분 생각은 달라요 왜 모두 날 친구로 알죠?

translation.en: He's not my friend. Why does everyone assume that?
translation.ko: 왜 모두 날 친구로 알죠? 그가 요청했고 도우러 오셨잖아요

translation.en: Well, why else would he ask for you
and why would you come here to help him? I didn't come here to help him. I came here to bury him.
translation.ko: 돕자는 게 아뇨 극형을 받게 하려는 거요

translation.en: Linsky.
Who the hell is Jack Reacher?
HELEN: So why are you so hard to find?
I'm impossible to find.
Why is that? Well, you could say it started out as an exercise and became an addiction.
Are you on the run?
My bus is leaving. You better hurry, counselor.
translation.ko: 곧 버스 떠나요 서둘러 물어보세요 어떤 사이죠?

translation.en: Why are you representing him?
I'm a lawyer. So is a public defender, with just as much chance of clearing Barr.
I'm not trying to clear him, I am just trying to keep him off death row.
By proving he's insane? Well, that's one option.
And sticking it to your father because...
No. Not my father.
The Office of the District Attorney. Because the Office of the District Attorney never bought you a pony.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 바쁜 부친이 안 놀아줘 복수하는 거요?

translation.en: D.A. Rodin's never lost a capital case. You know why?
Impeccable tailoring.
He never picks a fight he can't win.
Worked for the Red Baron. Every murder suspect in this town is given a choice. Confess or face death.
translation.ko: 살인 피의자는 자백 안 하면 사형돼요

translation.en: Against a D.A. who never loses.
translation.ko: 게다가 상대는 100% 이기는 검사여서 변호도 못해보고 패한 죄수도 있을 거라구요

translation.en: My firm has reason to believe more than one innocent man has gone down without a fight.
translation.ko: 변호도 못해보고 패한 죄수도 있을 거라구요

translation.en: Oh, I get it.
You're an idealist.
No. I'm a pacifist.
It's a noble crusade.
translation.ko: 일종의 고결한 전쟁이다? 이건 절대 성전이 아뇨 바는 유죄요

translation.en: But this is not the fight. Trust me. James Barr's guilty.
translation.ko: 이건 절대 성전이 아뇨 바는 유죄요 증거를 못 봤잖아요

translation.en: You haven't even seen the evidence.
Is this a privileged conversation?
translation.ko: 이 대화, 기밀 유지 됩니까? 물론이죠, 저와의 대화는 다!

translation.en: Of course, it's a client conference. Nothing you say here can be repeated.
There are four types of people who join the military.
translation.ko: 군인은 네 부류가 있소 가업을 잇는 자

translation.en: For some, it's a family trade.
translation.ko: 군인은 네 부류가 있소 가업을 잇는 자 조국에 봉사하려는 애국자

translation.en: Others are patriots, eager to serve.
translation.ko: 조국에 봉사하려는 애국자 일자리 필요한 자

translation.en: Next, you have those who just need a job.
translation.ko: 일자리 필요한 자 마지막은 합법적으로 죽이려는 자

translation.en: Then there's the kind who want a legal means of killing other people.
James Barr was one of those.
He made sniper.
translation.ko: 그는 저격수였소 독하게 훈련 받았어요 매주 2천 발!

translation.en: Trained hard. Two thousand rounds a week.
translation.ko: 독하게 훈련 받았어요 매주 2천 발! 십자선에 맞춰 백발백중 맞추는 연습을 했죠

translation.en: And with every shot, he's taught to visualize
translation.ko: 십자선에 맞춰 백발백중 맞추는 연습을 했죠

translation.en: the base of a man's skull through his reticle.
translation.ko: 십자선에 맞춰 백발백중 맞추는 연습을 했죠 척수가 뇌 밑에서 넓어지는 숨골에 맞춰

translation.en: The sweet spot where the medulla meets the spine.
translation.ko: 척수가 뇌 밑에서 넓어지는 숨골에 맞춰

translation.en: Visualize that puff of pink mist.
translation.ko: 붉은 피 안개가 솟는 상상을 하며!

translation.en: (CLICKS)
Finally, he's deployed to Iraq.
He's put on overwatch.
translation.ko: 임무는 감시였죠 하루 종일 망원경으로 감시했어요

translation.en: All day long he stares through a scope at civilians.
Women.
Children.
Day in, day out, for two long years
translation.ko: 그렇게 장장 2년 동안 실전에선 한 발도 쏴보질 못한 거죠

translation.en: without ever once being cleared to fire a single shot.
translation.ko: 실전에선 한 발도 쏴보질 못한 거죠

translation.en: Then comes the drawdown.
For James Barr, the war's over.
Two thousand rounds a week.
A quarter million rounds in his career, not one at a human target.
translation.ko: 25만 발 쐈어도 사람은 하나도 못 쐈소

translation.en: You've been hungry. You've been horny.
translation.ko: 군에선 성욕과 식욕을 억눌러야 해요 긁지 못해 계속 간지러운 느낌이랄까

translation.en: You've had an itch you can't scratch.
translation.ko: 긁지 못해 계속 간지러운 느낌이랄까 365일 그 느낌으로 산다고 상상해봐요

translation.en: Imagine that feeling. Days. Weeks. Years.
translation.ko: 365일 그 느낌으로 산다고 상상해봐요 그 상상에 25만 배를 곱해봐요

translation.en: Imagine that feeling times 200,000, plus 50,000 more.
translation.ko: 그 상상에 25만 배를 곱해봐요 매일 땡볕에서 대기했는데 철수해야 한다니!

translation.en: Imagine it's 130 degrees on the deck
and tomorrow you're going home
translation.ko: 매일 땡볕에서 대기했는데 철수해야 한다니! 지금 안 긁으면 다신 못 긁는다

translation.en: and you know if you don't scratch that itch now, you never will.
translation.ko: 지금 안 긁으면 다신 못 긁는다

translation.en: You need a release.
You need a target.
translation.ko: 표적이 필요했소 누굴 저격할지 기준도 없었죠

translation.en: And the who of it never once enters your mind.
He covered his tracks well,
just like sane people do.
He almost got away with it, too. But I caught him. And he confessed.
translation.ko: 완전 범죄가 되기 직전 제가 잡았고 자백 받았소

translation.en: So why didn't he go to prison?
translation.ko: 근데 왜 수감 되지 않았죠? 바는 몰랐었소 그가 쏜 민간 업자들은

translation.en: What Barr didn't know that day was the four civilian contractors he'd picked off
translation.ko: 바는 몰랐었소 그가 쏜 민간 업자들은 주말에 집단 성폭행을 하고 나온 거였죠

translation.en: just spent the weekend at what they call a rape-rally.
translation.ko: 주말에 집단 성폭행을 하고 나온 거였죠

translation.en: It was 28 women, ages 54 on down to 11.
translation.ko: 11세부터 54세까지 여성 28명 수사 종료 직전 밝혀낸 건데요

translation.en: Those were just the ones I could find before the case was shut down.
translation.ko: 수사 종료 직전 밝혀낸 건데요 캐면 캘수록 더 추악한 게 나왔죠

translation.en: See, the deeper I dug, the uglier it got.
translation.ko: 캐면 캘수록 더 추악한 게 나왔죠 불명예자 낙인이 찍히려던 그에게

translation.en: And after seven long years of "Mission Accomplished,"
translation.ko: 불명예자 낙인이 찍히려던 그에게 민간 기업 쪽이 조용히 덮자고 했소

translation.en: someone in the corporation just wanted the whole thing to end quietly.
translation.ko: 민간 기업 쪽이 조용히 덮자고 했소 사망한 이유에 딴 구실을 붙여서 말이죠

translation.en: So they chalked it up to the fog of war,
translation.ko: 사망한 이유에 딴 구실을 붙여서 말이죠

translation.en: made the murders go away.
translation.ko: 사망한 이유에 딴 구실을 붙여서 말이죠 기밀이 틀림없군요

translation.en: This is classified information.
And that's why the privilege.
But you were ready to tell this to the D.A.
translation.ko: 근데 아버지께 하려던 말 아녔나요? 바를 마지막 봤을 때 약속한 게 있소

translation.en: The last time I saw Barr, I made him a promise.
translation.ko: 바를 마지막 봤을 때 약속한 게 있소 난 뉴스를 봤고, 그 약속 지키러 온 거요

translation.en: And when I saw his name on the news, I came here to keep it.
translation.ko: 난 뉴스를 봤고, 그 약속 지키러 온 거요

translation.en: But now I know I don't have to. How can you be sure?
You still haven't seen the evidence.
Your father has.
translation.ko: 이길 재판만 하는 댁의 부친이 갖고 있죠

translation.en: And he doesn't pick a fight he can't win.
translation.ko: 이길 재판만 하는 댁의 부친이 갖고 있죠 바는 다신 풀려나지 못해요

translation.en: Barr's not getting away with murder again.
He might.
He suffered a severe brain injury in state custody.
translation.ko: 이송 때 뇌를 심하게 다쳤으니까 깨어나도 사건과 모든 걸 기억 못 할 거예요

translation.en: When he wakes up, if he wakes up, he may not remember the event, he may not remember anything at all.
translation.ko: 깨어나도 사건과 모든 걸 기억 못 할 거예요

translation.en: And this case won't be about James Barr's guilt or innocence.
It'll be about his ability to stand trial.
translation.ko: 법정에 설 수 있는지를 가릴 판결이 될 거예요

translation.en: After everything I just told you, you still want to defend him?
I want to see he gets a fair trial.
You said he confessed in Baghdad.
He didn't confess this time.
translation.ko: 이번엔 안 했어요 -영리한 처신이죠 -그가 당신을 요청했고

translation.en: This time he knows better. This time he asked for you.
I want to know why. You want to know why. I can see it's eating you.
translation.ko: 우린 그 이유를 알고 싶어하죠 댁은 저보다 더!

translation.en: And you can't ask Barr, and the D.A. won't let you see the evidence.
translation.ko: 댁은 그에게 물을 수 없고 증거도 못 봐요

translation.en: My lead investigator has complete access to the evidence. All of it.
translation.ko: 근데 저의 수석 수사관은 열람 권이 있죠

translation.en: So where's your lead investigator? About to catch a bus out of town.
Thanks for the coffee, counselor.
You understand you're not just asking me to look at the evidence.
translation.ko: 증거를 봐 달란 부탁이 다가 아니죠? 유죄가 뻔한 잔인한 살인자인데도

translation.en: You're asking me to look at a cold-blooded killer.
A man I know to be guilty.
A man you want to keep off death row.
translation.ko: 사형을 막으려고 만나봐 달라는 거죠? 그런 자를 내 객관적인 눈으로!

translation.en: And you're asking me to look at him objectively.
Yes, that is what I'm asking.
I'll do it. On one condition.
Name it.
You have to look at the victims objectively.
How do you suggest I do that?
Yes? Mr. Farrior?
I'm Helen Rodin. We spoke on the phone.
Of course.
You said you're defending the man that ki...
That man.
HELEN: I represent James Barr, yes.
FARRIOR: And you have questions about my daughter?
HELEN: I do.
FARRIOR: What for?
translation.ko: 왜 궁금하죠? 피해자들을 더 잘 알고 싶어요

translation.en: I was hoping to get a better sense of who the victims were as...
translation.ko: 피해자들을 더 잘 알고 싶어요 그들이 생전 어떤 분이었는지...

translation.en: That is to say, who they were as people. As human beings. (SCOFFS)
That's a bit unusual, considering your position, isn't it?
That is true.
Normally someone in my position would want the jury
translation.ko: 저의 신분에서는 배심원들이 어떻게든 최대한 모르게 하려고 하죠

translation.en: to know as little as possible about the...
translation.ko: 어떻게든 최대한 모르게 하려고 하죠 그에게 죽은 사람들에 관해 모르게 해야잖소?

translation.en: FARRIOR: The people that your client killed.
translation.ko: 그에게 죽은 사람들에 관해 모르게 해야잖소?

translation.en: In cold blood.
Have you spoken with the other families?
translation.ko: 다른 피해자 가족도 만나시오? 네, 말씀을 해주겠다는 분들만

translation.en: Yeah, some. The ones who would speak with me.
Come in.
Thank you.
FARRIOR: Chrissie was a nanny.
She had a little girl with her that day.
Yes, I know.
Are you gonna go talk with that child?
translation.ko: 그 아이도 만나려는 겁니까? 그럴 리가요

translation.en: No, of course not. I...
Why not?
Well, I think it would be... Insensitive?
Inappropriate?
Everything that you want to know about my daughter
translation.ko: 내 딸에 관해 알고 싶어하는 건

translation.en: is right here.
The Gazette did a nice piece on her.
Her obituary does the rest.
Thank you. I'll definitely have a look.
You a good attorney, Miss Rodin?
That's not really for me to... Just
answer the question.
Yes, I suppose I am pretty good.
Good enough to keep that man off death row?
You know,
I think maybe I should go.
You stay where you are.
That man deserves to die, Miss Rodin.
Why would you defend him?
translation.ko: 왜 변호하죠? 제가 끔찍한 실수를 저질렀네요

translation.en: I can see that I have made a terrible mistake.
And I'm very, very sorry and I promise I won't bother you again.
Hello, Dad.
What the hell are you doing?
What am I... What?
translation.ko: 제가 뭘? 피해자 가족 만나잖아, 그것도 혼자?

translation.en: Is it true? You're talking to the victims' families? You? Alone?
How do you know that? How did you find me here?
I'm the District Attorney. It's my business to know.
That's not an answer. Oh. Well, you're not the only one
translation.ko: 너와 일하는 수사관만 뛰어난 줄 알아?

translation.en: with crack investigators, Helen.
translation.ko: 너와 일하는 수사관만 뛰어난 줄 알아? 그래, 나도 그 자를 알지

translation.en: That's right. I know about Reacher.
translation.ko: 그래, 나도 그 자를 알지 2년간 종적이 묘연했던 퇴역 군인이야

translation.en: Your lead investigator is a war veteran who's been missing for the last two years.
How can you vouch for his state of mind? How can you trust anything he tells you? You don't know the man.
translation.ko: 그런 자의 말과 정신 상태를 어떻게 믿지?

translation.en: Tell me this,
translation.ko: 네가 돈 못 줄 형편인 거, 그가 알아?

translation.en: does he know you can't pay him?
translation.ko: 네가 돈 못 줄 형편인 거, 그가 알아? 네 법률 회사도, 누구도 이 사건 원치 않아

translation.en: That your own firm didn't want this case? That nobody wants this case?
translation.ko: 네 법률 회사도, 누구도 이 사건 원치 않아

translation.en: You never even spoke to your client before he wound up in a coma.
translation.ko: 넌 혼수 상태 전엔 얘길 나눠본 적도 없어 잘 들어라, 부모여서 하는 충고야

translation.en: Oh, now listen to me! Listen. Listen, I'm speaking as your father.
Whatever our differences have been in the past, you gotta listen to me now.
translation.ko: 우리가 뭐 때문에 다투었든 잘 들어

translation.en: You're making a terrible mistake.
translation.ko: 넌 굉장히 큰 실수를 하는 거야

translation.en: You cannot win this case.
You're going to ruin your career. Why? For what?
translation.ko: 네 경력에 먹칠이야, 도대체 왜 이러는 거니?

translation.en: To hurt me? To change me?
Helen... Don't touch me!
REACHER: Thanks for letting me take a look.
translation.ko: 덕분에 잘 봤소 친구 돕자고 흠을 찾겠지만 뭐, 상관없소

translation.en: Hey. We love it when friends of the accused
translation.ko: 친구 돕자고 흠을 찾겠지만 뭐, 상관없소

translation.en: try to tear our work to shreds.
translation.ko: 친구 돕자고 흠을 찾겠지만 뭐, 상관없소 친구 아니오

translation.en: He's not my friend.
translation.ko: 친구 아니오 계속 아니라고 하는데, 흠은 찾았소?

translation.en: So you keep saying. Find any holes?
translation.ko: 계속 아니라고 하는데, 흠은 찾았소? 그가 중상을 입도록 방치한 실수

translation.en: Well, you didn't have to put him in the hospital.
Other than that, damn fine police work. It's open and shut.
What can I say? The scene was a gold mine.
translation.ko: 운도 따랐죠, 완벽한 범행 현장 덕에 운만 따랐을까, 증거를 찾아낸 공이 크죠

translation.en: Come on. Now we both know gold's only as good as the man digging.
translation.ko: 운만 따랐을까, 증거를 찾아낸 공이 크죠 필요하면 언제든 열람하러...

translation.en: Yeah, well, anytime you want to come back, take a look at this stuff...
translation.ko: 필요하면 언제든 열람하러... 그럴 필요 없겠소

translation.en: No, thanks. Don't need to.
translation.ko: 그럴 필요 없겠소 기록을 안 하는군요

translation.en: You never took any notes.
Oh, I don't need to.
(CHUCKLING) So you were some real hot shit in the Army, huh?
I did all right.
translation.ko: 만족스러웠소 헌병은 뭘 해요? 술집 패싸움 말리나요?

translation.en: So what does an Army cop do mostly?
translation.ko: 헌병은 뭘 해요? 술집 패싸움 말리나요?

translation.en: Break up bar fights?
translation.ko: 헌병은 뭘 해요? 술집 패싸움 말리나요? 형사님과 똑같은 일을 하죠 차이가 있다면...

translation.en: I did what you do pretty much, with one minor difference.
translation.ko: 형사님과 똑같은 일을 하죠 차이가 있다면... 그게 뭐죠?

translation.en: What's that?
Every suspect was a trained killer.
Thanks again.
Why do you think he paid for parking?
Pardon?
translation.ko: 무슨 뜻이죠? 군중에다 대고 여섯 발 쏠 냉혈한이

translation.en: He's about to fire six shots into a crowd of strangers.
translation.ko: 군중에다 대고 여섯 발 쏠 냉혈한이 주차 딱지 끊길까 봐 걱정했다?

translation.en: And he's worried about the meter maid?
"Simple loony" won't do it for you?
translation.ko: 미쳤는데 뭐는 못 하겠소? 그럴싸한 가설은 없소?

translation.en: I like to have at least one alternate theory.
Habit.
Muscle memory.
I don't think he knew he was doing it.
Like I said, it's damn fine work.
Hey, Army.
What's the serial number on the rifle?
What's the date on the quarter?
Forest for the trees, Detective.
Forest for the trees.
Mind if I share your table?
I'm Sandy.
So was I. Last week.
On a beach, in Florida.
What's your name?
Jimmie Reese.
You don't look like a Jimmie.
What do I look like?
I don't know. But not a Jimmie.
So you're new in town?
Usually.
It's kind of loud in here.
translation.ko: 여긴 시끄러워 조용한 데로 갈까? 차도 있어

translation.en: Do you want to maybe go someplace quieter? I have a car.
You're old enough to drive?
I'm old enough to do a lot of things.
I'm on a budget, Sandy.
What?
I can't afford you.
I'm not a hooker.
Oh, then I really can't afford you.
translation.ko: 데이트는 돈이 더 들어서 싫어 난 그 자동차 부품점에서 일한다구

translation.en: Seriously, I work at the auto parts store.
What I mean is, the cheapest woman tends to be the one you pay for.
translation.ko: 몸 파는 여자한텐 돈이 덜 들어가지

translation.en: I am not a hooker!
No. A hooker would get the joke.
MAN: What's this? He called me a whore.
Is that true?
Well, nobody said whore. She inferred hooker, but I meant slut.
Hey. That's our sister.
Is she a good kisser?
Hey. Outside.
Pay your check first.
I'll pay later.
You won't be able to.
You think?
All the time. You should try it.
It's a great joke, but I'm going to beat your ass. Do you want to do that here or outside?
translation.ko: 넌 죽었어, 여기서 죽을래 밖에서 죽을래?

translation.en: Outside.
Stay here, Sandy.
I don't mind the sight of blood.
When it means you're not pregnant, anyway.
translation.ko: 하긴, 매달 한 번씩은 볼 테니까

translation.en: You still think you're funny now, creep?
translation.ko: 너가 지금 재밌다고 생각해? 변태! 닥쳐, 너한테 말 거는 사람 없어

translation.en: Shut your mouth, Sandy! No one is talking to you.
translation.ko: 닥쳐, 너한테 말 거는 사람 없어

translation.en: It's your last chance to walk away.
Are you kidding? It's five against one.
It's three against one.
How do you figure?
translation.ko: 산수도 못 뗐나? 난 몸통 부터 끝장내 그건 너지

translation.en: Well, once I take out the leader, which is you,
translation.ko: 난 몸통 부터 끝장내 그건 너지 그다음 피 끓는 오른팔 둘만 끝장내면

translation.en: I'll have to contend with one or two enthusiastic wingmen.
translation.ko: 그다음 피 끓는 오른팔 둘만 끝장내면

translation.en: The last two guys, they always run.
Oh, you, uh, you've done this before?
It's getting late.
Remember,
you wanted this.
It's okay. You're okay.
Now we know who's who.
Let's get this done.
Really?
On the ground!
That's a pretty impressive response time, fellas.
COP 1: Do it!
COP 2: Hands behind your back.
Who hired you?
COP 2: Let's go.
Hey, Helen.
HELEN: Am I wearing too much perfume?
Breathing too sternly. Detective Emerson.
translation.ko: 당신 숨소리는 힘이 넘치거든 -죽은 자라도 있소? -있다면?

translation.en: Somebody dead? And if someone is?
Then they died of shame. 'Cause I was being gentle.
translation.ko: 있다면 쪽 팔려 죽은 거요, 손가락만 꺾었거든 왜 정착 못 하는지 알 거 같소

translation.en: I'm starting to understand why you move around a lot, Reacher.
translation.ko: 왜 정착 못 하는지 알 거 같소

translation.en: REACHER: So no one's dead.
translation.ko: 사망자는 없다는 거군 한 친구가 거의 못 걷게 됐소

translation.en: One guy likely won't ever walk right again.
translation.ko: 한 친구가 거의 못 걷게 됐소 -날 처넣고 싶죠? -무척!

translation.en: REACHER: You want to charge me. EMERSON: Very much.
But no one's pressing.
Sadly, no.
Am I free to go?
Hey, Emerson.
What's that?
translation.ko: 그게 뭐요? 바가 쏜 소총의 일련번호

translation.en: It's the serial number on Barr's rifle.
You're working for me, do you understand that?
translation.ko: 날 위해 일하는 거 잊었어요? 저와 회사의 명예에 먹칠하지 마요

translation.en: So everything you do is a reflection on my firm. On me.
I was set up.
There was this girl.
She came onto me. Picked a fight.
translation.ko: 여자가 접근, 싸움을 부추긴 거요 술꾼의 상습 변명이죠

translation.en: Which never happens in a bar.
translation.ko: 술꾼의 상습 변명이죠 이름을 대자 여자가 흠칫했어요

translation.en: She was thrown when I told her my name.
translation.ko: 이름을 대자 여자가 흠칫했어요 마이크 타이슨 기대했대요?

translation.en: She was expecting Mike Tyson?
translation.ko: 마이크 타이슨 기대했대요? 지미 리스라니까 놀란 거죠

translation.en: She wasn't expecting Jimmie Reese.
Yankees second baseman.
Why did you say you were a Yankees second baseman?
I always use Yankees second basemen. I didn't say I was a Yankees second baseman, I just said...
translation.ko: 난 양키스 2루수 이름을 빌려만 쓸 뿐이오

translation.en: Look, the point is, she was expecting to hear "Jack Reacher."
She knew who I was.
translation.ko: 내 존재를 알아요 경찰도 번개처럼 떴었고!

translation.en: And the cops were rolling before the fight even started.
translation.ko: 내 존재를 알아요 경찰도 번개처럼 떴었고! 놈들이 여자의 오빠? 개가 웃겠군

translation.en: And those five guys are her brothers? Come on.
Someone sent those boys to put me down.
Who?
HELEN: If someone followed you at the river today,
it was probably a cop. And I highly doubt...
translation.ko: 당신의 뒤를 밟았다면 경찰일 거예요 경찰이 안 하는 세 가지가 있어요

translation.en: There are three things cops never do.
translation.ko: 경찰이 안 하는 세 가지가 있어요 민주당 안 찍고 캐딜락 안 타며 자가용 타고 미행하진 않아요

translation.en: They don't vote Democrat, they don't drive Cadillacs, and they never use personal vehicles.
translation.ko: 민주당 안 찍고 캐딜락 안 타며 자가용 타고 미행하진 않아요

translation.en: It's not a cop.
A P.I., then, or the D.A.'s office.
translation.ko: 탐정이나 검찰 쪽이든가! -당신 아버진 아닐까? -어떻게 감히?

translation.en: You think your father's office would set me up? Why would anyone set you up?
How was your day?
It went exactly the way I think
you hoped it would.
You okay?
What'd you learn?
HELEN: Chrissie Farrior was 22.
A nanny caring for the six-year-old daughter of family friends.
She'd finally saved enough money for a trip to China,
in fact, she should have left the week before.
translation.ko: 돈 모아서 중국여행 가려 했는데 아이가 자기 생일에 꼭 있어달라 했대요

translation.en: But the girl she cared for wanted Chrissie to stay for her 7th birthday.
translation.ko: 아이가 자기 생일에 꼭 있어달라 했대요

translation.en: They'd gone downtown that day to shop for a party dress.
translation.ko: 결국 옷 사러 가다가 당한 거죠

translation.en: Rita Coronado worked as a cleaning lady at the River Cross Plaza.
She was usually late for work, but she had a good reason.
Since her son Marco was nine years old
translation.ko: 아홉 살 난 아들을 매일 학교에 바래다 줘야 했대요

translation.en: she had to personally drop him at school to make sure he actually went.
translation.ko: 매일 학교에 바래다 줘야 했대요 그런 헌신 덕에

translation.en: But her dedication had paid off.
translation.ko: 그런 헌신 덕에 아들은 우등생이 됐어요

translation.en: Marco was now an honor student.
translation.ko: 아들은 우등생이 됐어요 선물로 처음 야구장에 가기로 했고

translation.en: As a reward for all his hard work,
Rita was taking him to his first baseball game.
translation.ko: 선물로 처음 야구장에 가기로 했고 그날 표를 사러 가고 있었어요

translation.en: And she was on her way to pick up the tickets that very afternoon.
Nancy Holt's last words to her husband were a lie.
I love you, babe. See you! Bye.
translation.ko: 사랑해 차 정비소에 간다 했지만 실은 시내에 갔죠

translation.en: She told him she was taking her car to be serviced, but in fact, she was headed downtown.
translation.ko: 차 정비소에 간다 했지만 실은 시내에 갔죠

translation.en: It's perfect.
translation.ko: 남편 몰래 산다며 카드 대신 현금을 냈어요

translation.en: She told the clerk she didn't want the purchase showing up on her credit card.
translation.ko: 남편 몰래 산다며 카드 대신 현금을 냈어요 결혼 10주년 깜짝 선물이라면서...

translation.en: She wanted to surprise her husband for their 10th anniversary
just a few days away. Thank you.
Oline Archer never liked her husband's construction business,
translation.ko: 올라인은 남편 건설업이 늘 불만 이었대요 가장 큰 회사들 중 하나로 함께 키우곤 말이죠

translation.en: even after helping him become one of the largest contractors in the county.
translation.ko: 가장 큰 회사들 중 하나로 함께 키우곤 말이죠 암튼 남편 건강이 나빠졌고

translation.en: So it came as a relief when his failing health and a costly lawsuit
translation.ko: 암튼 남편 건강이 나빠졌고 소송비용 때문에 사업을 넘겨야 하자 안도했겠죠

translation.en: were forcing them to sell to the competition.
translation.ko: 소송비용 때문에 사업을 넘겨야 하자 안도했겠죠

translation.en: Rob?
Help! Help!
Her husband had given his life for the company.
But now that it was hers,
translation.ko: 회사를 떠안은 아내는 회사를 지키고 싶어했고

translation.en: she couldn't bring herself to let it go.
She was on her way to secure a loan that day
translation.ko: 그날 대출 받으러 간 거예요 그토록 싫어한 사업을 살려보려고...

translation.en: so she could keep the business she'd always hated.
Darren Sawyer was an investment broker
in the same building where Rita worked.
translation.ko: 투자중개인 대런은 리타와 같은 빌딩이었죠 아내 얘기론, 최근 사이가 멀어졌고

translation.en: His wife said he'd grown increasingly distant of late.
translation.ko: 아내 얘기론, 최근 사이가 멀어졌고 어렴풋한 마지막 대화도 무척 나빴 대요

translation.en: She can't remember their last words to one another, but they weren't kind.
translation.ko: 어렴풋한 마지막 대화도 무척 나빴 대요 대런 곁엔 아침에 산 꽃이 있었어요

translation.en: Darren's body was found beside a fresh bouquet of roses he'd bought that morning
translation.ko: 대런 곁엔 아침에 산 꽃이 있었어요 아내는 마지막 순간에 남편이 생각한 사람이

translation.en: and his wife takes comfort in the fact that, in his last moments,
translation.ko: 아내는 마지막 순간에 남편이 생각한 사람이 자기란 걸 깨닫곤 위안받는대요

translation.en: he was most likely thinking of her.
We're gonna be okay. We're gonna be okay.
We're gonna be okay.
translation.ko: 우린 무사할 거야 괜찮아 우린 무사할 거야 괜찮아

translation.en: We're gonna be okay, we're gonna be okay,
REACHER: So what'd you learn?
You want me to say you were right. You want me to say that this isn't the fight.
James Barr should die.
Maybe he should.
translation.ko: 그래야만 하구요 희생자에 관해 뭘 알아냈냐고 묻잖아요?

translation.en: I meant, what did you learn about the victims.
What more do you want?
They were five innocent people senselessly murdered.
translation.ko: 무고한 다섯 명이 죽은 사실을요 옷 입어요

translation.en: I'm sorry. Could you please put a shirt on?
This is my shirt.
You lose your luggage?
I don't have any luggage.
Uh, what was I saying?
Five innocent people. Murdered at random, yes.
(EXHALES DEEPLY) You know how many people die in this country every year?
translation.ko: 매년 미국에서 몇 명이 죽는지 압니까?

translation.en: Two and a half million.
That means every day,
roughly 7,000 average Americans wake up for the last time.
Last Friday, five of them converged
on a single spot and died together. Is that random?
translation.ko: 근데 한 장소에서 5명이 죽었는데 무작위다? 아니면요?

translation.en: What else would you call it?
Well, take Darren and Nancy. Odds are they were having an affair.
Excuse me?
You don't buy roses for your wife on the way to work.
translation.ko: 아내한테 줄 꽃은 출근 대신 퇴근 때 사야 맞소

translation.en: You buy them on the way home.
And you don't worry about a charge
showing up on your credit card
translation.ko: 명세서는 한 달 뒤 받는데 왜 현금으로 샀죠?

translation.en: when your anniversary is that weekend.
Unless it's the gift you're hiding.
And that's why she kept walking
while everyone else ran.
You can't prove that.
translation.ko: 뭐로 장담하죠? 알아내는 게 힘들까요? 통화기록, 이메일

translation.en: How hard would it be? Cell phones, e-mails.
All it takes is someone willing to dig.
translation.ko: 알려고만 하면 간단해요 그럼 핵심이 뭐죠?

translation.en: What's your point exactly?
translation.ko: 그럼 핵심이 뭐죠? 그 둘은 이유 없이 거기 있던 게 아니었소

translation.en: My point is that two of the victims weren't there strictly by chance.
translation.ko: 그 둘은 이유 없이 거기 있던 게 아니었소

translation.en: I need a list of Barr's known associates.
translation.ko: 바의 친구 명단이 필요해요 없어요, 외톨이고 이웃과 대화도 없었대요

translation.en: There isn't one. He didn't have any.
He's a classic loner. He didn't even talk to his neighbors.
translation.ko: 없어요, 외톨이고 이웃과 대화도 없었대요 조용하며 누구도 안 괴롭혔고?

translation.en: He was a quiet man. Never bothered anyone.
Yeah, exactly. You have his credit card statement?
I can get it. Why?
translation.ko: -그의 카드내역 있소? -찾죠, 왜죠? 술집, 볼링장 등 들락거린 곳을 찾아 봅시다

translation.en: I need the list of all the places he hung out. Bars, bowling alleys, strip clubs,
translation.ko: 술집, 볼링장 등 들락거린 곳을 찾아 봅시다

translation.en: gun ranges.
Anywhere someone would remember him. What do we hope to find?
I need some sleep.
You, too.
You don't really think I'm gonna...
Be back to pick me up at 7:00.
Yep. Absolutely.
Who's with you?
What happened?
Oh, that's him, isn't it?
I ain't seeing you, man!
Relax. What happened?
Barr's attorney hired an investigator.
translation.ko: 바 변호인이 수사관을 고용했어 이름은 리처, 전직 베테랑 헌병

translation.en: Name of Reacher. Some sort of top-shelf Army cop.
translation.ko: 이름은 리처, 전직 베테랑 헌병 바 처럼 이라크 참전

translation.en: He was in Baghdad the same time as Barr.
So?
So Barr asked for this soldier by name.
translation.ko: 바가 놈을 불러 달랬어 놈은 오늘 강과 다리를 들쑤셨고

translation.en: Then he shows up at the river today. Then up on the highway.
Almost like he knew something.
And you said we don't like people asking questions. No, we sure don't.
So I took steps.
You took steps.
Local people. My guys.
And it blew back on you.
I figured five guys would do it.
Mmm. This franchise was yours to manage.
translation.ko: 넌 뒤나 캐는 게 전문이야 손봐주는 건 우리 전문이고, 알아?

translation.en: That's all. Maintenance is our thing, you understand?
translation.ko: 손봐주는 건 우리 전문이고, 알아? -연락 돼야 말이지 -그건 내 전문이야

translation.en: Yeah, I understand. I couldn't reach you!
Well, I had to make a decision!
These locals, I want their names. It's in the file.
Any of them know who you are?
Just one, but I took care of it.
(SIGHS) Where's the body? It's distributed.
(SCOFFS)
Relax! No one's gonna find it. Suppose we want it found, yeah?
Why the hell would you want it found? 'Cause we got a way of doing things so they stay done.
Clean!
A missing person isn't clean.
translation.ko: 실종자의 가족이 가만 있을까? 하나 대신 다섯을 죽인 넌 완벽했고?

translation.en: Christ's sakes, man. You only had to kill
translation.ko: 하나 대신 다섯을 죽인 넌 완벽했고?

translation.en: one goddamn person. You tapped five! You call that clean?
translation.ko: 하나 대신 다섯을 죽인 넌 완벽했고? 그래야 경찰은 피해자 대신 범인에 집중하는 거야

translation.en: I call it done. They're looking at the shooter, not the target.
translation.ko: 그래야 경찰은 피해자 대신 범인에 집중하는 거야

translation.en: Jesus.
translation.ko: 젠장! 실타래는 심하게 꼬아야 못 푼다는 이치다

translation.en: We make it messy now so it won't get messy later.
translation.ko: 실타래는 심하게 꼬아야 못 푼다는 이치다 털어도 먼지조차 안 나게 하려면!

translation.en: And we don't leave questions unanswered ever.
translation.ko: 털어도 먼지조차 안 나게 하려면! 알았어요 제가 뒤처리할게요

translation.en: Okay, all right. Okay. I can fix this.
translation.ko: 알았어요 제가 뒤처리할게요 -눈을 떠라 -보면 안 되잖아요?

translation.en: MAN: Open your eyes. No, I ain't seeing you!
translation.ko: -눈을 떠라 -보면 안 되잖아요? 본다고 이제 달라질까?

translation.en: MAN: It makes no difference now.
I made a mistake.
I mean, you can still use me, just tell me how to fix...
To survive.
translation.ko: 안 죽을 방법 찾는 게 급선무 아닐까?

translation.en: Don't say "fix it," because you can't.
translation.ko: 안 죽을 방법 찾는 게 급선무 아닐까? 다 지어놓은 밥마다 코 빠트리는 놈

translation.en: We covered up the one mess. You made another.
translation.ko: 다 지어놓은 밥마다 코 빠트리는 놈

translation.en: All right. You're right.
You're right. You're absolutely right. I'm sorry.
translation.ko: 지당한 말씀입니다 잘못했어요 제가 어떡해야 할지 알려 주세요

translation.en: Just tell me what I have to do.
I was in prison in Siberia.
translation.ko: 난 시베리아 감옥에 있을 때 죽은 자의 코트로 첫 겨울을 버텼다

translation.en: I spent my first winter wearing a dead man's coat.
translation.ko: 죽은 자의 코트로 첫 겨울을 버텼다 주머니에 구멍 뚫린 코트였지

translation.en: A hole in one pocket.
I chewed these fingers off before the frostbite could turn to gangrene.
translation.ko: 난 동상에 걸린 손가락이 썩기 전에 다 물어뜯었다

translation.en: These I gave up to avoid working in the sulfur mine.
That is how I survived when so many others did not.
A man this rare can always be of use.
So show me. Show me you are rare.
Show me you'll do anything to survive.
translation.ko: 살기 위해 뭘 할 건가 보여봐

translation.en: I don't understand.
translation.ko: 무슨 뜻인지... 왼손 손가락을 전부 물어뜯어

translation.en: The fingers from your left hand.
Have you... Have you got a knife?
translation.ko: 혹시 칼 있어요? 시베리아에서 내가 칼이 있었을까?

translation.en: Did I have a knife in Siberia?
No... Come on, you've got to be kidding.
You can do it.
Show me.
Can't! I can't.
translation.ko: 못합니다 전 못하겠어요 순순히 총에 죽겠다니, 어리석은 것들!

translation.en: Always the bullet. I can't! I don't understand.
What do we do about the soldier?
What we always do.
Barr's credit card statement. Eyewitness testimonies.
Coffee. You take it black, right?
Yeah. What can I say? I take my work home.
Afraid Barr's credit card statement's a dead end.
translation.ko: 카드 내역만 갖곤 알아낼 게 없네요

translation.en: No bars, no strip joints, nothing. Pretty much just gas and groceries.
translation.ko: 술집 따윈 안 갔고 주유소나 식품점이 다예요

translation.en: I need you to look for gun ranges
between 100 and 150 miles from here.
translation.ko: 160-240km 범위 안쪽 사격장만 찾아요 사거리는 270m 넘는 곳만

translation.en: Limit your search to ranges longer than 300 yards.
Sure, if you tell me why.
translation.ko: 그러죠, 이유는? 토, 일요일마다 차에 가득 주유했고

translation.en: Barr consistently filled his tank on Saturday,
and again on Sunday.
translation.ko: 토, 일요일마다 차에 가득 주유했고 장거리를 달렸어요

translation.en: He took a long drive almost every weekend.
He could be going anywhere. Yes.
And if it's bars, bowling alleys or strip clubs,
we'll never find it.
translation.ko: 술집, 스트립쇼 볼링장이면 찾기 힘들죠 사격장이면 얘긴 달라요 두 개쯤 있을까?

translation.en: But a Match-level gun range? There might be two.
translation.ko: 사격장이면 얘긴 달라요 두 개쯤 있을까? 실탄은 직접 만든 거라 엄청 쐈을 거요

translation.en: And he made his own bullets. That means he shot a lot.
translation.ko: 실탄은 직접 만든 거라 엄청 쐈을 거요

translation.en: I'm guessing every Saturday.
Maybe with a friend.
translation.ko: 친구도 동행했소 친구가 있다 쳐요, 캐봤자 뭐가 도움되죠?

translation.en: Why is it so important you talk to his friends?
translation.ko: 친구가 있다 쳐요, 캐봤자 뭐가 도움되죠?

translation.en: Assuming he had any.
Drop me at the auto parts store.
I... Wait. Which one?
translation.ko: 어디에 있는? 그 여자가 그 자동차 부품점 이랬소

translation.en: I don't know. She just said "the auto parts store."
translation.ko: 그 여자가 그 자동차 부품점 이랬소 여자라뇨? 자세히 말해 봐요

translation.en: She? Who?
Reacher, can you be a little more specific?
I didn't say "an auto parts store."
translation.ko: 그냥 부품점이 아니고 그 부품점이면 대뜸 어디가 떠오르죠?

translation.en: Which one stands out in your mind as the auto parts store?
HELEN: You want me to wait?
No, I'll meet you back at the office later.
I'll hitch a ride.
Can I help you?
Sandy work here?
What's this about?
So she does, thanks. I need to speak with her.
It's a personal matter.
translation.ko: 여기 일하는군, 사적인 일로 만나야겠소 -업무 중이오 -사적 법적인 일이오

translation.en: She's on the clock. Legal personal matter.
What are you, a cop?
Call her out, Gary.
Well, I need to see something.
How about the inside of an ambulance?
Okay, I'm calling the police.
I don't think Sandy wants the police involved...
Hello? ...but let's ask.
Hey! You ca... Hello? I need some help. Hello? Hey! You!
No. You are not allowed back in here, man!
Shit.
You know this guy?
Tell him.
Give us a few, Gary.
Listen, I wasn't... I didn't know.
translation.ko: 있잖아요, 저는 몰랐어요 그런 싸움 생길 줄 몰랐어요

translation.en: I didn't know that was going to happen!
It was Jeb.
The big guy.
Jeb Oliver.
He told me you were a predator. You were supposed to start groping me.
translation.ko: 색광인 당신이 내게 집적댈 거라고 했죠

translation.en: Just don't hurt me.
Sandy, sit down.
Where can I find Jeb?
I don't know. He didn't come to work today. So he works here.
Yeah.
It's bullshit, though. He cooks crystal.
His address, write it down.
I'm really sorry, mister.
You were supposed to be a pervert.
And it was an easy 100 bucks.
That's all?
When Jeb asks, you do what he says.
Am I in trouble?
Not if you lend me your car.
I don't have a car. Well, sure you do. It's outside.
I'm guessing you're the Camaro. That whimsy little pickup has Gary written all over it. Keys?
translation.ko: 카마로는 네 차잖아 픽업 트럭은 게리 차고

translation.en: I can't. It's Jeb's car!
translation.ko: 안돼요 젭의 차예요 내가 직접 갖다 주면 좋아라 하겠군

translation.en: Well, won't he be surprised when I drive it home for him.
translation.ko: 내가 직접 갖다 주면 좋아라 하겠군

translation.en: Who are you, mister?
Really?
I'm just a guy who wants to be left alone.
I get off work at six!
Maybe we could...
Sandy, listen.
Now, you seem like a sweet girl.
You're pretty.
You're obviously sharp,
doing Gary's books for him.
You don't have to let these guys use you.
It's just what girls like me do.
translation.ko: 저 같은 여잔 잘 속나 봐요

translation.en: You got money?
A little.
Get out of town for a couple of days.
Why?
Get out of town, Sandy.
Is Jeb home?
I have a warrant to search the premises.
I see.
Well, if you don't mind...
MAN: Get him! Get him! Get him!
I got this!
Don't move.
I'll tell you what.
When I move, you pull the trigger.
Aah!
Where's Jeb? He's not here.
Where can I find him?
Jesus! My hand!
translation.ko: 제발, 내 손 총은 장난감이 아냐 놈은 어딨나?

translation.en: Well, you shouldn't play with guns.
Where can I find him? You're the one driving his car. You tell... (CRIES OUT)
translation.ko: 젭의 차를 타고 왔으면 더 잘 알 거 아니에요

translation.en: The last I saw him, we was all leaving jail.
He said he had to see a guy.
translation.ko: 구치소에서 나와 누군가 만나러 간댔어요 -누구? -저는 몰라요

translation.en: What guy? Who? I don't know.
I don't know, I swear.
translation.ko: 맹세코! 엄마 말로는 다음날 짐 싸서 사라졌대요

translation.en: Next I know, his mom woke up from a bender and his shit's all gone.
translation.ko: 엄마 말로는 다음날 짐 싸서 사라졌대요

translation.en: Is he the sort to light out like that?
translation.ko: 자주 사라지나? 절대, 엄마 혼자 놔둔 적 절대 없다구요

translation.en: No, no, man. He'd never leave his moms alone.
translation.ko: 절대, 엄마 혼자 놔둔 적 절대 없다구요

translation.en: Shit ain't right.
translation.ko: 절대, 엄마 혼자 놔둔 적 절대 없다구요 -너 차 있나? -밖에요

translation.en: Got a car? It's outside.
Keys.
My hand, man. They're in my pock... Aah! Okay, okay.
Now look at your friends.
Now look at my face.
Do you ever want to see me again?
No way.
Am I stealing your car?
Use it as long as you like.
You're very kind.
REACHER: I think Jeb Oliver's dead.
Who's Jeb Oliver? He was the guy from the bar.
Jesus, how hard did you hit him?
What? No, not me.
No, he was murdered. And someone tried to make it look like he left town.
translation.ko: 누군가가 죽였고, 여길 뜬 것처럼 위장했소

translation.en: Well, maybe he just left town.
You pack your shower curtain when you travel?
Is this what you base your conclusions on? What is that on your head?
You don't want to know.
You said on the phone you wanted to submit your findings.
James Barr was a sniper. Not the best, not the worst.
But he trained non-stop for two years. What does training like that do?
What does any training do? Skills become reflex. Muscle memory.
translation.ko: 동물적으로 사격 하게끔 조련 하는 거?

translation.en: You do without thinking.
translation.ko: 전술을 강제적으로 주입, 안 똑똑한 자도

translation.en: It also makes people who aren't necessarily smart seem smart
translation.ko: 전술을 강제적으로 주입, 안 똑똑한 자도 명석해 보이게 만드는 훈련이죠

translation.en: by beating some tactical awareness into them.
translation.ko: 명석해 보이게 만드는 훈련이죠 99% 불리한 지금의 증거들은 이라크 때와 딴판이오

translation.en: Now, 99% of the evidence your father has against Barr
translation.ko: 99% 불리한 지금의 증거들은 이라크 때와 딴판이오

translation.en: didn't exist in Baghdad,
translation.ko: 99% 불리한 지금의 증거들은 이라크 때와 딴판이오 명석하진 않지만 그는 숙련된 저격수죠

translation.en: not because Barr was smart, but because he was trained.
See, from that garage,
the shooter had the sun in his eyes.
translation.ko: 주차빌딩에선 해가 눈을 찔렀고 표적이 좌우로 움직여서 조준엔 최악이었죠

translation.en: Targets were moving left and right.
It's difficult conditions for any sniper.
translation.ko: 표적이 좌우로 움직여서 조준엔 최악이었죠 이라크에서도 주차장에서 쐈잖아요?

translation.en: But Baghdad, you said Barr was in a parking garage then.
translation.ko: 이라크에서도 주차장에서 쐈잖아요? 그땐 해가 뒤에 있어서 눈을 안 찔렀고

translation.en: REACHER: Because in Baghdad, the sun's behind him.
translation.ko: 그땐 해가 뒤에 있어서 눈을 안 찔렀고 표적은 직선으로 일렬이었소

translation.en: Targets coming straight ahead, single file.
Ideal conditions for even an average shooter
and the exact same conditions
translation.ko: 똑같은 조건을 원했다면 다리 위에서 쐈어야 했소

translation.en: he would've had up on that highway bridge.
Up there, he would never even have to get out of the van.
No parking meter.
No camera.

translation.ko: 이라크 전우가 홀연히 사라졌는데, 혹시나 해서요?

translation.en: The guy just dropped off the grid, you know?
translation.ko: 이라크 전우가 홀연히 사라졌는데, 혹시나 해서요? 간혹 있는 일이지

translation.en: It happens. Yep. Yeah. Yeah. Anyway, he was a shooter.
Last I heard, he lived around here somewhere and I... When did he get out of the Army?
Well, I didn't say the Army.
translation.ko: 육군이라 안 했어요 전우라 했잖소? 해병은 아녔던 거 같고!

translation.en: Well, you said you served with him. You're no jarhead.
translation.ko: 전우라 했잖소? 해병은 아녔던 거 같고! 그 정돈 눈 감고도 알아본다네

translation.en: Man on a flying horse could see that.
translation.ko: 그 정돈 눈 감고도 알아본다네 아버진 해병이었죠 맘에 듭니까?

translation.en: Well, my father was in the Corps, if that helps.
translation.ko: 아버진 해병이었죠 맘에 듭니까? 그럼 반쪽은 남자라 칠 수 있지

translation.en: Well, (CHUCKLES) that makes you half human.
translation.ko: 그럼 반쪽은 남자라 칠 수 있지

translation.en: Your friend got a name?
Yeah. James Barr.
James Barr.
Never heard of him.
I think you have.
I think you've been dreading the moment
translation.ko: 경찰이 와서 물을까 봐 겁내는 눈치군요?

translation.en: some cop comes in here asking after him.
translation.ko: 경찰이 와서 물을까 봐 겁내는 눈치군요? 그가 왔었다는 걸 치맛바람 주부들이 알면

translation.en: Because it's for sure some soccer mom around here
translation.ko: 그가 왔었다는 걸 치맛바람 주부들이 알면

translation.en: is more worried about your range than she is about the pool in her backyard
translation.ko: 그가 왔었다는 걸 치맛바람 주부들이 알면 사격장이 버젓이 있도록 놔두진 않을 거 같은데요?

translation.en: or the drain cleaner under her sink.
Wouldn't matter to her if Barr did his killing 100 miles away,
translation.ko: 그가 160km 바깥에서 살인했지만 문제는 그가 여기서 연습을 했고, 그게 알려지면

translation.en: only that he came here to rehearse. She'd have a case to shut you down
translation.ko: 문제는 그가 여기서 연습을 했고, 그게 알려지면

translation.en: and nothing better to do.
What do you want?
I want to know who Barr's friends were.
Those boys out there,
they're mighty touchy when it comes to their constitutional rights.
translation.ko: 법적 권리 얘길 꺼내면 엄청 광분하지 경찰이 그들을 캐러 왔다고 전해야겠군

translation.en: Suppose I tell them a cop is in here asking after my members?
translation.ko: 경찰이 그들을 캐러 왔다고 전해야겠군 -경찰 아닙니다 -아니면?

translation.en: I'm not a cop. What are you?
translation.ko: -경찰 아닙니다 -아니면? 바의 변호인을 돕죠 무죄를 믿거든요

translation.en: I work for Barr's attorney.
We have reason to believe he's innocent.
The hell you say. Be that as it may, I'm the only one who's bothered to track him this far.
translation.ko: 유죄라 해도 저만큼 깊게 조사한 자는 없죠

translation.en: You help me out, I'll be in your debt.
And if I don't?
Maybe you can coach soccer.
You put three in the center and maybe we'll talk. Huh?
Can I have a few to warm up?
Six inches right.
That's your mulligan, Mr. Ward. Play ball!
Let's go.
You're a little rusty, Mr. Reacher.
I saw a man by that name shoot for the Wimbledon Cup,
translation.ko: 자넨 10년 전 사격 시합에 나온 워드도...

translation.en: what, ten years ago.
translation.ko: 자넨 10년 전 사격 시합에 나온 워드도... 1925년에 뛴 양키스 2루수 워드도

translation.en: And I'm pretty sure you never played second base for the Yankees
Now,
I'll answer one question.
Who's your best shooter?
James Barr.
I pulled all these down as soon as I heard about the shooting.
That's the best shot
translation.ko: 최고 기록이야 이렇게 쏜 민간인은 처음이야

translation.en: I ever seen this side of civilian life.
Suppose I told you Barr wasn't this good on his best day in the Army.
translation.ko: 군에서도 이 정도는 아녔다고 했을 텐데요? 내가 직접 서명한 표적이야

translation.en: I handed out those targets myself.
That's my scrawl on every one.
Do you hang them downrange, too?
What, are you serious?
I'm saying it's possible that Barr had a friend.
translation.ko: 친구와 왔을 가능성이 있다는 거죠 표적 수거 때 일행이 바꿨을 수 있죠

translation.en: One who switched the targets on the range.
translation.ko: 표적 수거 때 일행이 바꿨을 수 있죠

translation.en: Maybe Barr let him.
Made him feel like King Shit having his name up on your wall.
translation.ko: 바를 띄워 주려고 의도적으로! 최고 기록을 남한테 준 명사수는 본 적이 없어

translation.en: I never saw one real shooter who would do that for his own mother.
translation.ko: 최고 기록을 남한테 준 명사수는 본 적이 없어

translation.en: Unless he was framing his mother for multiple murder
and using your range to do it.
Barr didn't come alone, did he?
You know, one of these nuts is likely to kill you,
they find that camera, there. Hell, the camera's there 'cause one of these nuts is likely to kill me.
translation.ko: 날 죽일까 봐 설치한 게 저 카메라지

translation.en: There's Barr.
I always liked him. Always liked him.
Him.
That son of a bitch.
Helen Rodin speaking.
translation.ko: 헬렌 로딘 입니다 유력한 진범을 찾았어요

translation.en: REACHER: Got a candidate for our shooter. Picture, possible prints
and one pissed-off eyewitness.
I can't talk right now.
Just give me three hours to get back.
translation.ko: 3시간 뒤 갈 때까지 누구한테도 입 열지 말아요

translation.en: And don't talk to anyone until I get there.
translation.ko: 누구한테도 입 열지 말아요 조사해보겠습니다 감사해요

translation.en: I'll look into that, thanks.
This is just what I could pull this morning.
translation.ko: 오늘 아침 확보한 거예요 납세기록, 계약서 시와 주의 사업허가증

translation.en: Tax records, city and state permit applications, contract bids.
translation.ko: 납세기록, 계약서 시와 주의 사업허가증 러시아에서 독립한 그루지야의 유령회사 자료

translation.en: Shell corporation in Georgia. That's the one next to Russia, not Florida.
They work one city at a time,
translation.ko: 대형 도시개발 사업을 시에서 발표할 때마다

translation.en: acquiring a local construction concern
translation.ko: 대형 도시개발 사업을 시에서 발표할 때마다 지역의 건설회사를 착착 집어먹었어요

translation.en: just ahead of major civic redevelopment.
translation.ko: 지역의 건설회사를 착착 집어먹었어요 불필요한 교량들과 고속도로도 짓고요

translation.en: They build bridges no one needs. Highways no one uses.
They're like a cancer. A cell that won't stop growing.
They moved 12 times in 15 years.
Atlanta, Albuquerque,
translation.ko: 15년간 12번 옮겼어요 애틀랜타, 앨버커키 오스틴, 오클라호마 시티, 새크라멘토

translation.en: Austin, Oklahoma City, Sacramento.
translation.ko: 오스틴, 오클라호마 시티, 새크라멘토 사라져버린 수백만 달러의 국채 등

translation.en: Always amidst allegations of corruption
translation.ko: 사라져버린 수백만 달러의 국채 등 항상 부패 혐의가 따라다녀요

translation.en: including millions of dollars in missing public funds.
translation.ko: 항상 부패 혐의가 따라다녀요 그런데도 어떤 조사나 수사도 없었어요

translation.en: And yet never an investigation.
Never even an inquiry.
translation.ko: 그런데도 어떤 조사나 수사도 없었어요 표면적으론 흠잡을 데 없는 회사죠

translation.en: It's as if Lebendauer Enterprises were above reproach.
(SIGHS) Well, maybe that's because the allegations come from the competition.
Outbid. Bitter.
Like Oline Archer.
translation.ko: 올라인 같은... 부패 공무원들과 끈이 닿아있거나

translation.en: Or maybe Lebendauer has the cooperation of key officials.
translation.ko: 부패 공무원들과 끈이 닿아있거나 끈으로 해결이 안 될 땐

translation.en: And maybe when that cooperation isn't enough,
translation.ko: 끈으로 해결이 안 될 땐 올라인 같은 경쟁자를 제거하겠죠

translation.en: they kill people who won't be bought off.
Like Oline Archer.
Helen, how much of this do you honestly believe? It doesn't matter how much I believe.
It doesn't even matter how much I can prove. It only matters how much is true.
translation.ko: 얼만큼 사실인지 밝히는 게 중요한 거죠

translation.en: Do you know how delusional you sound?
What happened to you?
translation.ko: 왜 이렇게 변했죠? 제 말 무시하며 바를 사형 시킬 생각만...

translation.en: Are you really so set on putting this man to death that you'd ignore...
translation.ko: 제 말 무시하며 바를 사형 시킬 생각만...

translation.en: I pulled all of this paper under my own name.
If Jack Reacher's right,
my life, your daughter's life,
is in danger now.
Whatever happens to me next is on your head, whether you're involved or not.
translation.ko: 아빠가 연루됐건 안됐건 그렇게 되면 아빠 책임이에요

translation.en: You are the District Attorney and I've given you compelling evidence
translation.ko: 난 아빠한테 못 뿌리칠 증거를 드렸어요

translation.en: to investigate Lebendauer Enterprises.
translation.ko: 놈들 회사를 수사해야 한다구요 내 편인지 놈들 편인지 행동을 보여줘요

translation.en: Your next move will tell me which side you're on.
translation.ko: 내 편인지 놈들 편인지 행동을 보여줘요

translation.en: I see. It's a test.
(CHUCKLES) Well, this may be hard for you to believe, but I do love you.
And obviously I'm not going to turn a blind eye, no matter how absurd I find all of this.
translation.ko: 내가 뭔가를 잘못 알고 있다 치자

translation.en: (SIGHS) So, if you really believe that you're in danger,
if you believe that,
then the next order of business,
is to put you in protective custody right now.
And how safe will I be if you're part of it?
Jesus, Helen.
Business meeting or personal?
translation.ko: 공적인 미팅? 아님 사적인? 글쎄요, 구별이 힘드네요

translation.en: Hard to tell them apart.
I'll bet.
(CELL PHONE RINGING)
translation.ko: 채석장 관리실 피츠버그 발신자와 연결 중

translation.en: Helen?
Sorry, wrong number.
Is this Reacher?
Who is this?
Is this Reacher?
It's you. The guy from the car.
It's your boyfriend.
Reacher, is it you?
Helen, are you hurt? Well, she's gonna be if you're not here in one hour.
Do I have to tell you how this works?
You'll bounce me around to make sure I'm not followed,
then walk me into an ambush and kill me.
Aw, you ruined my surprise.
translation.ko: "들켰군, 깜짝 선물인데!" 더 멋진 깜짝 선물이 있다

translation.en: Well, I can do one better.
translation.ko: 더 멋진 깜짝 선물이 있다 사격장에 갔었지

translation.en: I went down to the gun range at Hinge Creek.
translation.ko: 사격장에 갔었지 네놈 사진과 지문을 FBI에 넘길 거다

translation.en: I got the picture, prints, and I'm going to the Feds.
translation.ko: 네놈 사진과 지문을 FBI에 넘길 거다 여잔 맘대로 해

translation.en: The lawyer's all yours.
Get the Zec.
On second thought, I'd like to kill you.
Let's say winner take all.
Listen to me, you prick. I will kill this bitch if you're not here in one...
You think I'm a hero?
I am not a hero.
translation.ko: 난 영웅은 커녕 잃을 게 없는 떠돌이지

translation.en: I'm a drifter with nothing to lose.
translation.ko: 난 영웅은 커녕 잃을 게 없는 떠돌이지 날 모함하려고 넌 샌디를 죽였어

translation.en: You killed that girl to put me in a frame.
translation.ko: 날 모함하려고 넌 샌디를 죽였어 널 죽이고 피를 한 사발 마셔야 쓰겠다

translation.en: I mean to beat you to death and drink your blood from a boot.
translation.ko: 널 죽이고 피를 한 사발 마셔야 쓰겠다

translation.en: Now, this is how it's going to work.
You're gonna give me the address
and I'll be along when I am damn good and ready.
translation.ko: 그럼 기분이 땡길 때 방문해주지 그녀가 전화 못 받거나 다쳤다는 느낌이 들면

translation.en: If she doesn't answer the phone when I call this number, if I even think you've hurt her,
translation.ko: 그녀가 전화 못 받거나 다쳤다는 느낌이 들면

translation.en: I disappear.
translation.ko: 난 사라질 거다 내가 어떻게 등장할지 궁금하면 두뇌를 굴려봐

translation.en: And if you're smart, that scares you,
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 등장할지 궁금하면 두뇌를 굴려봐

translation.en: because I'm in your blind spot
translation.ko: 내가 어떻게 등장할지 궁금하면 두뇌를 굴려봐 난 신출귀몰이거든!

translation.en: and I have nothing better to do.
You got a pen?
Don't need one.
If I had a dollar for every time the Army called the Corps for help.
translation.ko: 해병한테 손만 내미는 육군은 대체 왜 그러는 건가?

translation.en: You have something for me? Yeah.
Here.
You're kidding, right?
Just because I saw you shoot ten years ago
translation.ko: -장난하세요? -10년 전 솜씨만 믿고 내 귀한 총을 섣불리 넘길 순 없지

translation.en: doesn't mean I'll let you kill some asshole with my gun.
translation.ko: 내 귀한 총을 섣불리 넘길 순 없지

translation.en: I told you how serious this was.
And I showed up, didn't I?
So let's get to it.
Now, your shooter will be
translation.ko: 놈들 저격수는 저 불빛 뒤에 숨어서 감시할 거야

translation.en: right up there behind those lights. Okay?
translation.ko: 저 불빛 뒤에 숨어서 감시할 거야

translation.en: He can cover both roads
translation.ko: 저 불빛 뒤에 숨어서 감시할 거야 도로 양쪽 모두

translation.en: coming and going.
translation.ko: 도로 양쪽 모두 자네가 몸을 노출하면 갈겨댈 거고!

translation.en: And kill you just as soon as you stand up.
Well, can you take him out?
What, to dinner you mean?
Look, I don't know the type of people
translation.ko: 자네가 어떤 부류와 주로 어울리는진 몰라도

translation.en: you normally associate with, Reacher.
translation.ko: 자네가 어떤 부류와 주로 어울리는진 몰라도 24시간 택배 서비스는 내 체질이 아냐

translation.en: But I'm not in the habit of driving out to the boonies at the drop of a hat
translation.ko: 24시간 택배 서비스는 내 체질이 아냐 낯선 자를 황천에 보내는 일도!

translation.en: and just picking off some total strangers, all right?
Anyway, I can't see anything, not with them lights up.
translation.ko: 어쨌거나 불빛 때문에 전혀 안 보여 그럼 전구를 쏴요

translation.en: So shoot them out.
Yeah, sure. And then he knows right where I am. I might as well set myself on fire.
No, sir. I'll start shooting when he does.
translation.ko: 난 놈이 먼저 쏘면 쏠 거야

translation.en: And how do you propose we get him started?
Well, you could always start running.
What's wrong with your eye?
I'm saving my night vision.
Hey, Gunny, you mind if I ask you kind of
a personal question?
translation.ko: 사적인 건데 하나 물어도 돼요? 총질 서툴까 봐 그러나?

translation.en: What, you don't think I can shoot anymore?
It is a perishable skill.
Yeah, well,
the sun will be up in an hour.
Let's get going.
I heard them call you the Zec.
That means "prisoner."
Yes?
Tell me, killing all those people,
I have to believe the money you're making
can't possibly be enough to just... Enough?
There is no such thing.
We take what can be taken.
This is what we do.
And you?
This one I think I understand, but you?
Why'd you do it?
translation.ko: 왜 발을 들였죠? 나한테 선택권 있었다는 투로 들리는군

translation.en: You make it sound like I had a choice.
Oh, didn't you?
You'll see.
You should know I've taken steps,
translation.ko: 일이 생기면 내가 짜 놓은 대책이...

translation.en: If anything happens to you,
translation.ko: 일이 생기면 자네 아버지 앞에서일 거다

translation.en: it will happen in front of your father
translation.ko: 일이 생기면 자네 아버지 앞에서일 거다 자넬 살려달라며 빌겠지

translation.en: while he begs for your life.
You should never have involved him.
translation.ko: 그가 못 끼어들게 했어야지 아버지한테 모든 걸 눈감으라고 해

translation.en: Now you will have to convince him to forget,
for your sake and for his.
You say nothing, but I see defiance in your eyes.
That is a look I have seen many, many times.
translation.ko: 난 그런 눈 셀 수 없이 봤었지 잭이

translation.en: When the soldier comes,
translation.ko: 잭이 눈앞에서 죽으면 자네 태도가 바뀌겠지?

translation.en: when you watch how he dies, it will change you.
You will want to forget me then.
translation.ko: 동시에 날 잊고 싶어 할 거고!

translation.en: Reacher?
REACHER: Are you okay?
They're ready for you.
They'd like to think so.
Don't do this. Please don't do this. Not for me.
Listen, Helen, they're not gonna hurt you until they have me.
translation.ko: 날 죽이기 전엔 당신을 죽일 수 없어요, 그리고 난 안 죽어요

translation.en: And that's never going to happen.
You just hang in there.
'Cause I'm coming to get you.
Now say you believe me.
I believe you.
This was a bad idea.
Any time now, Gunny.
Shit.
Where the hell are you, Gunny?
Suck it!
You should go.
Toss it.
REACHER: I know you're in there, Emerson.
It was staring me right in the face.
The one piece that just didn't fit.
The quarter.
Nobody would have thought to dump that meter.
translation.ko: 그걸 꺼내 조사할 생각은 아무도 못하지

translation.en: Not even me.
You were wrong about my father.
I wouldn't make a big thing of it.
Who is he?
That's John Doe Number Two.
The man on the grassy knoll. The thing under the bed.
They call him the Zec.
Zec? Prisoner.
What's your real name?
I was born in October. When I get to my birthday, I'm gonna pull the trigger.
One. Two.
Chelovek. Zec Chelovek.
Chelovek?
Chelovek? Human.
Prisoner Human Being.
That's your real name? That is all I remember.
Call the police.
Were you really going to shoot him?
I knew I wouldn't have to.
One look at this guy and you know he'll do anything to survive.
